title: Showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers may occur at several places in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Southern and Uva provinces and in Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy and Ampara districts during the evening or night.

title: Man stabbed to death in Kirindiwela
byline: A 42-year-old man has reportedly been stabbed to death with a sharp weapon in the Walgammulla area of Kirindiwela.

title: Two US Navy pilots shot down over Red Sea in apparent ‘friendly fire’ incident, US military says
byline: Two U.S. Navy pilots were shot down Sunday over the Red Sea in an apparent “friendly fire” incident, the U.S military said.

title: Chinese naval hospital ship ‘Peace Ark’ visits Sri Lanka
byline: The Chinese People’s Liberation Army Navy hospital ship ‘Peace Ark’ arrived in Colombo on a formal visit on Saturday (December 21).

title: Western Province contributed most to Sri Lanka’s GDP in 2023
byline: The Western Province accounted for the largest share (43.7 per cent) of Sri Lanka’s nominal GDP in 2023, although this indicated a marginal decline in its contribution compared to the previous year, according to the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: Ambassador of Norway calls on PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, welcomed the Ambassador of Norway to Sri Lanka, May-Elin Stener, during a courtesy call at the Prime Minister’s Office.

title: CBSL introduces new loan rescheduling measures for SMEs
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has issued a circular to licensed banks recently, highlighting relief measures to be provided to Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) affected by the Easter Sunday attacks, the COVID-19 pandemic, and the extraordinary macroeconomic conditions that prevailed in the recent past.

title: Ministry assures quality of MOP fertilizer donated by Russia
byline: The Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Lands, and Irrigation has issued a statement assuring the quality of the Muriate of Potash (MOP) fertilizer stock donated by a Russian state-owned company.

title: Delhi students send bomb threat to their schools to delay exams
byline: A bizarre revelation has emerged in the ongoing investigation into bomb threats sent to several schools in Delhi.

title: Albania declares one-year TikTok ban over stabbing
byline: Albania’s prime minister has announced the government intends to block access to TikTok for one year after the killing of a schoolboy last month raised fears about the influence of social media on children.

title: Compulsory retirement age for doctors extended
byline: An extraordinary gazette notification has been issued extending the compulsory retirement age of Government Medical Officers.

title: Sri Lanka’s 2025 holiday calendar: Here’s the full list
byline: With just nine days remaining until the start of 2025, the Government Printing Department has released the official calendar for the upcoming year, which includes 26 public holidays. Among these, April stands out as the month with the highest number of holidays, offering four in total.

title: Govt. generated over Rs. 4 billion through rice imports
byline: Traders across various regions have urged the government to reconsider the Rs. 65 per kilogram tax imposed on imported rice, advocating for a reduction to alleviate market challenges.

title: Gaza ceasefire talks 90% complete, Palestinian official says
byline: Talks to reach a Gaza ceasefire and hostage release deal between Israel and Hamas are 90% complete, but key issues remain that need to be bridged, a senior Palestinian official involved in the talks told the BBC.

title: Applications called for SLEAS Grade 1 principal posts in National Schools
byline: The Ministry of Education (MoE) has issued a special announcement regarding the process for filling vacancies in the Sri Lanka Education Administrative Service (SLEAS) Grade 1 Principal positions in national schools.

title: AHRC calls on President Dissanayake to prioritize urgent legal reforms
byline: The Asian Human Rights Commission (AHRC) has urged Sri Lanka’s President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to take immediate action to implement critical legal reforms aimed at restoring the rule of law in Sri Lanka.

title: Police launch special operation to inspect vehicles during festive season
byline: In response to the surge in accidents involving passenger transport buses and other vehicles, the Sri Lanka Police has announced that they will implement an island-wide traffic operation starting December 23, 2024.

title: Three cops transferred over arrest of writer Kasun Heenatigala
byline: Three police officers, including a Sub-Inspector, have been temporarily transferred to the Mirihana Police Headquarters in connection with the investigation into the arrest of writer Kasun Mahendra Heenatigala by the Athurugiriya Police recently.

title: Mother and daughter dead after being hit by train in Anuradhapura
byline: A mother and her daughter have lost their lives while attempting to take a selfie on the tracks near the Anuradhapura railway station this afternoon (22).

title: Deleted CCTV footage recovered in Hatton bus accident
byline: Police have recovered the CCTV footage alleged to have been deleted from the private bus involved in a tragic accident in the Malliappuwa area on Saturday (21), which claimed the lives of three people including a school student.

title: ADB assures commitment to address challenges in Sri Lanka’s education sector
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has met with the Country Director of the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to Sri Lanka Resident Mission, Takafumi Kadono.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says several spells of showers will occur in Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Fitch upgrades Sri Lanka to ‘CCC+’
byline: Fitch Ratings has upgraded Sri Lanka’s Long-Term Foreign-Currency Issuer Default Rating (IDR) to ‘CCC+’ from ‘RD’ (Restricted Default), citing the completion of the international sovereign bond restructuring and an improved outlook for macroeconomic indicators.

title: Two dead, dozens injured in car attack on German Christmas market
byline: Two people have been killed, including a child, and dozens injured after a car drove into a crowd at a Christmas market in the eastern German city of Magdeburg, officials say.

title: Sri Lanka to build on, maintain relations with Saudi Arabia: envoy
byline: Sri Lankan Ambassador in Riyadh Omar Lebbe Ameer Ajwad expressed his desire to elevate bilateral relations to new heights as Saudi Arabia and Sri Lanka celebrate 50 years of diplomatic ties.

title: One dead, 5 injured in accident on expressway
byline: One person has died, and five others have sustained injuries in an accident that occurred early this morning (21) near the Pinnaduwa interchange on the Southern Expressway.

title: Two dead, 23 injured as bus topples down precipice on Hatton–Kandy main road
byline: UPDATE: Two of the 25 injured individuals have succumbed to their injuries upon admission to the hospital, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Navy rescues 102 Rohingya refugees off SL coast; trawler crew remanded
byline: The crew of the fishing trawler from which Sri Lanka navy rescued over 100 Rohingya refugees in the island’s coast off Wellamulli Waikkal, have been ordered to be remanded in custody until December 31.

title: Private sector rice imports total 67,000 MT as deadline ends
byline: Sri Lanka Customs confirmed that a total of 67,000 metric tons of rice were imported by traders before the private sector’s rice import deadline expired at midnight yesterday (20).

title: 3 dead, over 20 injured as bus topples down precipice
byline: Another person who was injured and hospitalized during the passenger bus accident on the Hatton – Kandy main road has succumbed to injuries while receiving treatment at the hospital, Police Media Spokesman confirmed.

title: Sri Lanka captain Asalanka on Wellalage’s omission from NZ tour
byline: The Sri Lankan cricket team departed for New Zealand last night (20) to compete in a three-match T20 and ODI series.

title: Pakistan military court jails 25 over 2023 attacks
byline: Twenty-five civilians were sentenced by a Pakistani military court to periods of two to 10 years of “rigorous imprisonment” in connection with attacks on military facilities in 2023, the armed forces’ media wing said on Saturday.

title: CID records statements from officials over false information on Parliament website
byline: A team from the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has visited Parliament yesterday (20) and recorded statements from three officials, including the Assistant Secretary General of Parliament, regarding the incorrect use of the title “Dr.” before the name of Minister of Justice and National Integration Harshana Nanayakkara.

title: 5 injured as bus topples off road in Kadugannawa
byline: A passenger bus belonging to the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) has toppled off the road near the Dawson’s Tower in Kadugannawa, injuring 5 passengers who were travelling in the bus, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Gold prices surge in Sri Lanka
byline: Gold prices in Sri Lanka have seen a notable increase, according to the latest market data from the Colombo Gold Centre.

title: Treasury Secretary hails Sri Lanka exiting default after ‘painful reforms’ and complex debt restructuring
byline: The Secretary to the Treasury Mainda Siriwardena says that 20 December 2024 marked a major milestone in Sri Lanka’s economic recovery process as the country officially exited sovereign default.

title: Lycamobile warns UK staff nearly 90% of workers could lose their jobs
byline: Around nine in 10 Lycamobile UK workers have been warned they may lose their jobs in a widespread restructuring effort, raising concerns for an estimated 300+ employees just weeks before Christmas.

title: Sri Lanka repays local ISB holders with new rupee bonds
byline: Sri Lanka has repaid defaulted local bondholders with floating-rate rupee bonds, maturing between March 2023 and September 2043, as part of the restructuring of defaulted International Sovereign Bonds (ISBs), which was completed on December 20.

title: Surprise raid exposes alarming hygiene violations in Pettah restaurants
byline: A surprise inspection conducted by the officers of the Jinthupitiya Medical Officer of Health (MOH) office and Public Health Inspectors (PHIs) this morning (21) has revealed alarming hygiene violations in several restaurants on Bodhiraja Mawatha, Pettah.

title: President Dissanayake to visit China mid-January: Report
byline: Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will travel to the island’s largest bilateral lender China for talks in January, he said on Saturday, days after completing a long-delayed foreign debt restructure.

title: Iceland gets new government under Social Democrat Frostadottir
byline: Iceland’s president presented a new government on Saturday under Social Democratic Prime Minister Kristrun Frostadottir that aims to cut inflation and interest rates and hold a referendum on European Union membership by 2027, public broadcaster RUV said.

title: Gazette issued appointing 18-member ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ task force
byline: A Gazette notification has been issued appointing an 18-member Presidential Task Force, including the President’s Secretary, to oversee the implementation of the ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ initiative.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers will occur at times in Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Government extends rice importation period
byline: The government has announced its decision to extend the period for rice importation until January 10, 2025, with the final agreement expected to be confirmed at the Cabinet meeting scheduled for Monday (23).

title: Crowd crush kills 35 children at funfair in Nigeria, police say
byline: At least 35 children were killed and six others critically injured in a crowd crush at a funfair in southwest Nigeria on Wednesday, police said.

title: CBSL names 20 institutions being investigated over prohibited schemes
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has initiated proactive measures to address the alarming increase in prohibited schemes, which poses risks to the financial system stability and protection of the general public from such schemes.

title: Foreign Minister’s special press conference
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism, Vijitha Herath is currently holding a special press conference to provide insights into President Anura Kumara’s recent visit to India.

title: Deputy Minister discusses challenges hindering Sri Lankan industries’ growth with WB officials
byline: Deputy Minister of Industries and Entrepreneurship Development Chathuranga Abeysinghe has met with the World Bank’s Country Manager, Gevorg Sargsyan, and discussed several structural challenges that have hindered the growth of Sri Lankan industries over the past four decades.

title: SC upholds death sentence for Vass Gunawardena and four others
byline: The Supreme Court has upheld the death sentence imposed on former DIG Vass Gunawardena and four others, who were convicted over the abduction and murder of businessman Mohammed Siyam in 2013.

title: North Korean hackers stole $1.3bn of crypto this year - report
byline: A total of $2.2bn (£1.76bn) in cryptocurrencies has been stolen this year, with North Korean hackers accounting for more than half that figure, according to a new study.

title: Mainly fair weather expected to prevail today
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers may occur at a few places in Southern and Uva provinces and in Rathnapura district during the evening or night.

title: Trump threatens to retake control of Panama Canal
byline: President-elect Donald Trump threatened to reassert U.S. control over the Panama Canal on Sunday, accusing Panama of charging excessive rates to use the Central American passage and drawing a sharp rebuke from Panamanian President Jose Raul Mulino.

title: Customs says rice imports on hold until Gazette notification issued
byline: Sri Lanka Customs has announced that rice imports into the country will not be permitted under any circumstances until the relevant Gazette notification is issued.

title: Honda, Nissan set to announce launch of integration talks, sources say
byline: Honda  and Nissan  are expected on Monday to announce the start of business integration talks, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters, as the carmakers strive to survive a rapidly changing industry landscape.

title: SLPP considers contesting LG elections separately
byline: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) is reportedly leaning towards contesting the upcoming local government elections independently, according to party sources.

title: Tri-Forces security for ex-presidents to be withdrawn from today
byline: It has been decided to officially withdraw the tri-forces personnel assigned to the security of former presidents, effective from today (23).

title: Three more arrested in connection with Meegoda shooting
byline: Three additional suspects have been arrested in connection with the shooting and killing of a man traveling in a car at Nagahawatte in Meegoda on December 14, according to the Police Media Division.

title: Two arrested over threatening woman and demanding Rs. 1 mln ransom
byline: The Western Province North Crime Division has arrested two individuals involved in an incident of demanding a ransom from a woman after issuing death threats to her over the phone.

title: MoE announcement on commencement of school term
byline: The Ministry of Education (MoE) has issued a special announcement regarding the schedule for the second phase of the third school term in government and government-approved private schools for the academic year 2024.

title: 10 killed after small plane crashes in Brazil’s Gramado
byline: A small plane crashed into a Brazilian town that’s popular with tourists on Sunday, killing all 10 passengers on board and injuring more than a dozen people on the ground, Brazil’s Civil Defense Agency said.

title: ‘Squid Game’ returns looking for win with season 2
byline: Stepping onto the set of “Squid Game” season two, Lee Jong-jae felt like he had never left.

title: ASPI crosses 15,000 points for first time ever
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange recorded a new all-time high today (23), surpassing the 15,000 points mark for the first time in history.

title: Digitization of Sri Lanka’s public sector to begin in 2025
byline: Deputy Minister of Youth Affairs Eranga Gunasekara says that the project to digitize the country’s public sector will commence next year (2025).

title: Sri Lanka’s merchandise exports dip by 5.6% in November 2024
byline: Total exports for November 2024, including both merchandise and services, were recorded at US$ 1,269.33 million, reflecting a marginal increase of 0.04% compared to the same period in 2023, according to the Export Development Board (EDB).

title: Former Minister SM Chandrasena joins ‘Sarvajana Balaya’
byline: Former Minister S. M. Chandrasena has officially joined the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ political alliance today (23), receiving party membership from its leader MP Dilith Jayaweera.

title: Wagawatta Grid Substation connected to National Grid
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has announced that the newly-built grid substation at Wagawatta was connected to the national grid recently.

title: Person injured in shooting in Gampaha
byline: A person has been injured and hospitalized after being shot at by an unidentified gunman on a motorcycle at Weeragula in the Gampaha area.

title: Adani exploring ways to sell Bangladesh-bound power to Sri Lanka
byline: Adani Power is exploring ways to sell the Bangladesh-bound power, produced at the Godda plant in India’s Jharkhand state, to neighbouring countries such as Sri Lanka.

title: Unauthorized electric fences kill around 50 wild elephants in 2024
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) says that around 50 wild elephants have reportedly died so far this year (2024) after being electrocuted due to unauthorized electrical fences and illegally tapping into power lines.

title: Sri Lanka’s inflation drops further in November 2024
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the National Consumer Price Index (NCPI), has decreased to -1.7% in November 2024 from -0.7% in October 2024, according to the latest data released by  the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Sri Lanka holds first-ever national conference for families of missing persons
byline: The first National Conference for the Families of Missing Persons in Sri Lanka has been held in Colombo, facilitated by the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC), which brought together 51 families of missing persons from all communities in Sri Lanka, representing diverse regions.
